ritCentral.name: A Day at Hogwarts
ritCentral.description: A Day at Hogwarts will take you through the classes offered at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. Get ready to be immersed in the world of Harry Potter and learn about Ancient Runes, Potions, Herbology, Care of Magical Creatures, and more! Our exhibit will have activities throughout the day that will allow you to connect back to the Harry Potter books and movies through puzzles and snacks.
ritCentral.exhibitors: Kim Callahan, Lauren Carney, Samantha Herman, Sydney Kasok, Leah Ruth, Morrgan Sweeney-Charlton, Elyse Rood, Amanda Weiss, Nathaniel Stoll, Tyler Anderson, Camden Brockbank

ritCentral.name: African Percussion and Dance Ensemble
ritCentral.description: Performance of traditional West African music and Dance, in traditional African dress. Presentation will include arrangements of music that incorporate aspects of American Jazz and some non-western cultures.
ritCentral.exhibitors: Carl Atkins, Kwaku Obeng

ritCentral.name: Assistive Knee Brace
ritCentral.description: This project created an inexpensive knee brace that absorbs the shock of the patient's motion, making it easier to walk. The brace costs less than $100 and is comfortable enough for a patient to wear without pain after extended periods of time. This exhibit is participating in Dr. Destler's Health Innovation Challenge. Judging is pre-festival 9am-10am.
ritCentral.exhibitors: Emily Sanseverino, Ben Boseck, Dave Gooden, Andy Tock, Linzey Miller, Farrukh Mohuiddin, Mike Zona

ritCentral.name: Automatic Speech Recognition in a Medical Setting
ritCentral.description: Thousands of veterans return from the war and some have lost their hearing. They encounter communication barriers in talking with the doctors. We are developing automatic speech recognition for real-time captions in hopes of eliminating these barriers. Better communication means better access to health care for not only them, but many deaf and hard-of-hearing people as well.
ritCentral.exhibitors: Kabo Cheung, Mary Weber, Isabel Lainez

ritCentral.name: Autonomous Model Car Competition
ritCentral.description: Come see live racing of autonomous 1/18-scale cars created by student teams from RIT and other universities. In this competition, the winning car is the fastest to complete the track without derailing. The teams will be racing in Clark Gym during Imagine RIT. Practice trials will take place throughout the morning, and the competition will be from approximately 2:00 p.m. until 3:00 p.m. Come join the excitement and cheer for your family, friends, or your favorite team/car.
ritCentral.exhibitors: Roy Melton, Ray Ptucha, Louis Beato, Jay Yang, Aziz Alorifi, Adrita Arefin, Jeffrey Barker, Christopher Ranc, Steven Cacner, Erik Gustafson, Ransom Quinn, Robert Frumusa, Joshua Metzger, Cindy Gomez Silva, Michael Shullick, Barry Wu, Marisa Langlois, Ian Perry, Lucas Magalhaes, Drew Tosaya, Andrew Ramsey, Stephanie Soldavini, Malik Johnson-Wallace, Joshua Rosas, Andrew Lints, Long Pham, Will Gowell, Taikhoom Attar, Saidhon Orifov, Eric Scheler, Thomas Cenova, Ben Sentiff, Andrew Fountain, Joshua Serkes, Abhimanyu Gupta, Alexander Howard, Daniyal Iqbal, John Judge, Gregory Mullin, Gaitz Soponski, Suhail Prasathong, Inderjit Singh, Stephen Lucas, Christopher Sweet, Bao Thai, Adrian Tygart, Syed Ahmed, Uladzislau Maiseichykau, Ali Batayneh, Peter Budd, Gabe Landau

ritCentral.name: Autonomous People Mover, the Robotic Golf Cart
ritCentral.description: Today you can experience cutting edge autonomous vehicle technology. The Autonomous People Mover (APM) is a robotic golf cart capable of autonomously driving you between various locations without a driver. You can see your current location and choose a destination location on a digital map of campus. Using sophisticated sensors and computer algorithms, the APM will plan and follow a path while safely avoiding obstacles and pedestrians.
ritCentral.exhibitors: Abraham Long, William Fanelli, Jian Hong Wu, Giovanni Sabato, Ryan Trumpore, Ray Ptucha

ritCentral.name: Bike Blender
ritCentral.description: Pedal a bike and burn some calories making a healthy, delicious smoothie to cool yourself down. Stop by to watch, pedal, or cheer the riders on.
ritCentral.exhibitors: Andrew Lints, Aleks Huck, Eric Bowmaster, Bao Thai, Greg Felker, Molly Feldman, Spencer Perry, CJ Surrusco, John Owens, James Whitehill, Mike Chungbin , Jeff Phelps

ritCentral.name: Brick City Boppers
ritCentral.description: Jump Jive and Wail for Brick City Boppers, RIT's swing dance club! Join us as we showcase our club members in several upbeat dances. From Charleston to Lindy Hop and everything in between, it's sure to be a boppin' good time!
ritCentral.exhibitors: Kathy Clark, Guy Azriel, Suzannah Kaiser, Artem Pugachev, Yu Yan, Andy Lu, Naveena Shanmugam, Lily Cisco, Sara Zuwiyya, John Renner, Gina Kersey , Kyle Donahue, Jake Wales, Alyssa Keller, Jasmine Mead, Holly Gubanc, Olivia Fox, Alyssa Clymer, Aaron Cote, Emily Haldeman, Lillian Bokun, Rachel Hatalla, Daniel Schonfeld, Alex Kessler, Noah Parker, Zachary Eastberg, Dominic Cicilio

ritCentral.name: Celebrate Asian Heritage Month
ritCentral.description: Jump Jive and Wail for Brick City Boppers, RIT's swing dance club! Join us as we showcase our club members in several upbeat dances. From Charleston to Lindy Hop and everything in between, it's sure to be a boppin' good time!
ritCentral.exhibitors: Kathy Clark, Guy Azriel, Suzannah Kaiser, Artem Pugachev, Yu Yan, Andy Lu, Naveena Shanmugam, Lily Cisco, Sara Zuwiyya, John Renner, Gina Kersey , Kyle Donahue, Jake Wales, Alyssa Keller, Jasmine Mead, Holly Gubanc, Olivia Fox, Alyssa Clymer, Aaron Cote, Emily Haldeman, Lillian Bokun, Rachel Hatalla, Daniel Schonfeld, Alex Kessler, Noah Parker, Zachary Eastberg, Dominic Cicilio

ritCentral.name: DADCo: Consumer Focused Electromyography
ritCentral.description: DADCo wants to bring Electromyography (a biodiagnostic technique) into the consumer marketplace. We will be creating smartwatches and smart wrist-bands that interface with different electrical devices, including but not limited to smartphones, computers, and robotic prosthetics. At Imagine we are showing off a Bionic Hand concept that we have built for an amputee on campus. Exhibitors: Joseph DiPassio, Colin Fausnaught, John Grosh, and Dan Berg This exhibit is a participant in Dr. Destler's Health Innovation Challenge. Judging will be pre-festival from 9am-10am.
ritCentral.exhibitors: Colin Fausnaught

ritCentral.name: Encore A Cappella
ritCentral.description: Encore A Cappella is RIT's original all-female a cappella group. The group is composed of 12 ladies who love to sing music from a variety of different genres and decades.
ritCentral.exhibitors: Elizabeth Kuhl, Elizabeth Venditti, Jess Empey, Lindsey Dannenberg, Melanie Morris, Elyse Rood, Gianna Galluzzo, Jenna Ciganek, Maddy Baker, Sariana Mendez, Rachel Mickel, Guin Deroy

ritCentral.name: Fundus Camera - A Look Into Your Eyes
ritCentral.description: Fundus cameras are useful in determining the health of the eye and detecting defects but are currently only used in ophthalmologists' offices. The implementation of a more compact, cost-efficient camera would allow this tool to be implemented in General Practitioners' offices, allowing patients to get screenings during regular checkups. The goal of this project is to develop a working prototype of a low-cost fundus camera that obtains high quality images of the retina. This exhibit is a participant in Dr. Destler's Health Innovation Challenge. Judging will take place pre-festival from 9am-10am.
ritCentral.exhibitors: Briana Neuberger, Patrick Axel, David Lanza, Zachary Olmsted, Nate Rosengrant, Susan Farnand, Daniel Beim

ritCentral.name: GAIA: Sports Biometrics Tracking Apparel
ritCentral.description: GAIA is an athletic shirt than takes a quantitative approach to assessing athletic performance. During and after a workout, the user can see biometric data sent directly to their phone. The user can see their heart rate and muscular output in real-time. This technology can prevent injuries and improper training. Come and watch a live demonstration as the heart rate and muscular output of a member of our team are visually displayed on his phone as he goes through a workout. This exhibit is participating in Dr. Destler's Health Innovation Challenge. Judging is pre-festival 9am-10am.
ritCentral.exhibitors: Gwen Neuhaus, Brent Chase, Dakota Bassett, Liam Herlihy, Joseph Clifford, Grigoriy Gressel, Louis Beato

ritCentral.name: Japanese Animation and the Process
ritCentral.description: The RIT Anime Club presents a showcase of Japanese animation materials and outlines the complex process of digital animation. A variety of production materials and a reel of polished animation samples will be displayed to the public. In addition to a live drawing demonstration, visitors to our exhibit will have the opportunity to try their hand at digital drawing using a Wacom tablet.
ritCentral.exhibitors: Rochelle Cohn, Yaxin Zhang, Allister Gainey, Dany Inthaxoum, Derrick Loi, Ryan McGlinn, Christopher Omahen, Dakota Ryder

ritCentral.name: Model Railroad Club Open House
ritCentral.description: We will be hosting a special Open House so that visitors can tour our student designed and built HO scale model railroad, the Rochester & Irondequoit Terminal! Trains will be running and club members will be available to tell you more about our club and our model railroad. See our progress and learn more about the hobby of model railroading.
ritCentral.exhibitors: Nicholas Coriale, Ben Shaner, Charles Rothbart, Joseph Cermak, Alexander LaFleur, James Paterniti, Jack Cavanaugh, Theodore Johnston, Nathan Hernandez-Baquero, Alex Griswold

ritCentral.name: OvercomerTM: Overcoming Challenges-Changing Lives
ritCentral.description: OvercomerTM is a revolutionary adaptive fitness system that allows users with physical disabilities to engage in fitness and recreation like they couldn't before. In collaboration with Inclusivity Incorporated, OvercomerTM incorporates games such as soccer, hockey, baseball, and catch. So come and see OvercomerTM in action in this fun, interactive and one-of-a kind exhibit! This exhibit is participating in Dr. Destler's Health Innovation Challenge. Judging for the pre-festival challenge is taking place from 9am-10am.
ritCentral.exhibitors: Elizabeth Nicolas, Amy Hughes, Christopher Fenn, Josh Closson, Gerry Garavuso, Hannah Folby, Jason Constant, Jamie Moore, Emma Sarles, Robert Henry, Mandala Murphy

ritCentral.name: Repetition Rebellion
ritCentral.description: Repetition Rebellion is a Mental and Emotional health tracking app that can be prescribed by a mental/behavioral health care professional for a client meeting criteria for a variety of DSM 5 diagnoses including obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD), anxiety, and high functioning autism spectrum disorder (ASD).
ritCentral.exhibitors: Jenn Hinton, Sanika Sameer Kulkarni , Stephen Jacobs, Laurence Sugarman

ritCentral.name: Reporter Through the Ages
ritCentral.description: Established in 1951, RIT Reporter Magazine has evolved over time into the pronounced print and consistent online presence it embodies today. It is growing and changing constantly, from the way content is written to how art and video enhance each piece. This exhibit will tell a story of the evolution of the magazine by resurfacing strong archived articles and curating a visually compelling narrative that is new and innovative as a testament to the trajectory Reporter is on. We will be handing out Reporter t-shirts, other merchandise along with the May magazine and exclusive, annual Art&Photo* issue! *Disclaimer: contains some non-sexual nudity not suitable for all ages.
ritCentral.exhibitors: Mandi Moon, Rozie Yeghiazarian, Taylor Derrisaw, Alexis Montoya, Alissa Roy, Kevin Zampieron, Madeleigh Place, Ramya Shankar, Ryan Black, Alyssa Minko, Joe Jankowiak, Kristin Grant, Peter Willis, Francesco D'Amanda, Claire Fleming, Kendra Murphy

ritCentral.name: Resilient Vitality
ritCentral.description: Dr. Destler's Health Innovation Challenge enticed us to look at mental health treatment in a new way. We are creating an app, and computer program to better the courses of treatment of mental health. It will allow for monitoring of certain aspects of mood. This program will be utilized by practitioners and any person who uses the app store. Our main goal is to help a stigmatized group of people better tackle life. Come learn more about our process and aspirations for the future. This exhibit is a participant in Dr. Destler's Challenge. Judging will take place pre-festival from 9am-10am.
ritCentral.exhibitors: Zachary Probst, Anna Capria

ritCentral.name: RIT Drumline Performance
ritCentral.description: The RIT Drumline will be performing its percussion show as presented in competition with the New York State Percussion Circuit. We will also be performing a selection of original cadences and fan-favorite pop tunes!
ritCentral.exhibitors: Tommy Bohde, Justin Beigel, Jordan Bowman, Alexandrea Pritts, Tim Coon, Alec Bielanos, Athaxes Alexandre, Brady Sklenar, Eric Ruhl, Jake Barrow, Lucas Terrana, Sam Kuzio, Tom Brandow, Tom O'Brian

ritCentral.name: RIT Improv
ritCentral.description: RIT Improv will be performing a live improv comedy performance. Everything performed is made up on the spot, and is based off of suggestions of the audience. As a club, RIT Improv teaches improvisational workshops to students on campus as well as hosts performances with it's three performing troupes.
ritCentral.exhibitors: Wesley Odell, Alex Meddin, Rikesh Mistry, Noah Chrysler, Chris Carson, Brandon Datko, Nick Rabb, Steve Callen

ritCentral.name: RIT Motorsport Teams - 2017 Unveils
ritCentral.description: Watch RIT's five motorsport project teams unveil their 2017 cars! Hot lap demonstrations begin at the Simone Circle in front of the Student Alumni Union at 11 AM!
ritCentral.exhibitors: Jon Washington, Sam Kramer

ritCentral.name: RIT Pep Band Performance
ritCentral.description: The RIT Pep Band will be performing a selection of songs for Imagine RIT visitors as they walk to and from exhibits near the Tiger Statue. We will perform for an hour providing entertainment for visitors who want to walk by and visitors that want to stop and listen to us.
ritCentral.exhibitors: Amanda Meade, Garrett Waldron, Timothy Fairman, Megan Detwiler, Sarah Rote, Peyton Schmidt, Carleen Christner, Jacob Pratt, Lily Cisco, Alan Kuffner, Jillian Kopec, Jacob Cozzarin , Nicole Pannullo, Emily O'Connor, Alan Welch, Corinn Marriott, Elise Walsh, Wade Mauger, Andrew Streit, Sarah Messner, Kerstyn O'Brien, Michael Clavell, Tim Coon, David Routier, Melissa Barton, Mike Troise, Jeffrey Seamon, Ashley Resuta, Bao Thai, Neil Guertin, Kate Weidmann, Nathan Ehnot, Christine Miller , Brian Lake, Shelly Mason, Rhianna Hayes, Danielle Smith, Andrew Zgoda, Hannah Folby, Tommy Bohde, Jonathan Greeley, Surya Srinivasan, Ryan Hinkley, Kate Crowe, Abbey Snow, Gina Kersey , Zach Miller, Krysia Browka, Sydney Kaminski, Lucas VanDee, Alia Jordan, Ben Wilson, David Chinnici, Michael Gruskin, Will Smith, Jeffrey Taglic, Ethan Whitecotton, Katie Roy, Jack Hickson, Ye Ho, Kelsea Jones, Sami Berman, Susan Wimbrow, Kaity Moranz, Bryan Lin, Shannon O'Brien, Derek Fought, Peter Larson, Jessica Chellino, Clifford Sampson, Matthew Freyman, Brandon Jermyn, Nicholas Jakse, Danny Waheibi, Andrew Biviano, Sarah Nick, Steve Silkey, Dana Eschler, Sally Boniecki, Daniel Gude, Corry Straathof, David Anthony, Brian Kolkka, Steve Sarnecki, Juliana Fioravanti, Mike Hurlbutt

ritCentral.name: RIT's Eight Beat Measure
ritCentral.description: Come see Eight Beat Measure perform contemporary a cappella and learn more about how a cappella is arranged and sung!
ritCentral.exhibitors: Joseph Race, David Michels, Deshawn Cervi, Richard Toro, Brandon Lafever, Zack Worden, Daniel Boaitey, Sam Snyder, Nick Kowalczuk

ritCentral.name: Rochester Regional Health presents...Discover Your Inner Athlete!
ritCentral.description: After spending the day exercising your mind, how about a little physical challenge? It's "go time" in the 1829 Room! Visit Rochester Regional Health sports medicine docs and athletic trainers along with local athletes to learn how competitors achieve top performance and measure their progress. Test your agility, vertical and horizontal power, strength and movement as you move through a series of stations and get tips from the experts. You'll leave with a physical profile that you can use to track progress or compare with others. Spectators and competitors of all ages are all welcome!
ritCentral.exhibitors: Heather Cottone

ritCentral.name: Rochester Regional Health presents...Let's Talk Medicine!
ritCentral.description: As science advances, physicians must incorporate new info into care plans. It's tempting to think "let's do more", but sometimes the correct path is "let's do less". In this panel discussion, Rochester Regional Health physicians will talk about the use of less invasive or even non-invasive treatments and techniques. Dr. Jeremiah Depta, Dr. Lori Medeiros and Dr. Shahzad Mustafa will discuss trends in the treatment of heart disease, breast cancer surgery and allergies. Moderator: Dr. Richard Alweis, Associate Chief Medical Officer for Medical Education. Bring your questions!
ritCentral.exhibitors: Heather Cottone

ritCentral.name: Rochester Regional Health presents...Therapy Dogs!
ritCentral.description: Is a Therapy Dog the same as a Service Dog? What type of training do they need and how does their service affect those they meet? Therapy dogs at Rochester Regional Health spend their days (and sometimes nights) spreading affection, love and comfort. Learn more about the program, meet some of the canine team members and even take pictures with them. Bring your camera and be prepared to fall in love. Although our dogs love treats, please don't bring any food into the room. The handlers will be sure they get the right treats at the right time. Space is limited, so please arrive early.
ritCentral.exhibitors: Heather Cottone, Jeanne Colleluori

ritCentral.name: Semi-Active Wearable Tremor Mitigation Device
ritCentral.description: Our goal is to create a working prototype that can be worn on a person's arm/forearm that will decrease the intensity of essential tremor. Decreasing tremor intensity will allow people with essential tremor to live with increased confidence. So come by and see what's (not) shaking!
ritCentral.exhibitors: Peter Marcote, Sarah Sibert, James Wagner, Nicholas Lamb , Ramy Kila, Dan Phillips, Ed Hanzlik

ritCentral.name: SHIFT: A Smart Health Integrated Fitness Trainer
ritCentral.description: Our goal is to create a working prototype that can be worn on a person's arm/forearm that will decrease the intensity of essential tremor. Decreasing tremor intensity will allow people with essential tremor to live with increased confidence. So come by and see what's (not) shaking!
ritCentral.exhibitors: Peter Marcote, Sarah Sibert, James Wagner, Nicholas Lamb , Ramy Kila, Dan Phillips, Ed Hanzlik

ritCentral.name: Shining Light in Hospitals of the Developing World
ritCentral.description: This is a glimpse at what Engineering World Health does as an organization and what our RIT chapter does in the Rochester community and around the world. We will be showing a prototype free-standing surgical lamp and our Christmas light/cake pan bilirubin lights. In addition, we will be discussing how these devices are utilized in hospitals around the world. This exhibit is participating in Dr. Destler's Health Innovation Challenge. Judging will take place pre-festival 9am-10am.
ritCentral.exhibitors: Amy Hughes, Anthony Yosick, Cesar Augusto Rabello Borges Filho, Emma Sarles, Don Phan, Alyssa Tatti, Laura Alderfer, Ethan Griswold, Andrew Gosselin, Emily Lazarus, Ken Postel, Peter Todoro, Catherine Wright, Heejae Shin

ritCentral.name: SMIF: Smart Meals, Intelligent Fridge
ritCentral.description: SMIF (Smart Meals Intelligent Fridge) aims to make your food management a breeze by keeping track of what you eat in an unobtrusive and intuitive way. It remembers what you put in your fridge and is therefore capable of suggesting recipes, reminding you when you're running low on items, and informing you on food freshness. SMIF helps you have a healthy and balanced diet. It uses IOT devices and Machine Learning to achieve these things.
ritCentral.exhibitors: Jennifer Liu, Kyaw Khant Nyar, Harshvardhan Gupta, Robert Aguilera, Christine Van

ritCentral.name: SPEXcast Live! - Space Exploration Podcast
ritCentral.description: Listen to a live recording of SPEXcast, a space exploration podcast. Our panel talks about the new and exciting technologies that enable humanity to traverse the solar system, plus a Q&A session at the end!
ritCentral.exhibitors: Philip Linden, Thomas Tarazevits, Drew Walters, Mihail Barbosu, Jen Connelly

ritCentral.name: Surround Sound A Cappella Performance
ritCentral.description: Surround Sound, founded in 2001, is RIT's premier barbershop a cappella group. In addition to traditional barbershop music, they also sing nerdy songs, Disney songs, and "shopped" popular music. They enjoy good pasta, bad movies, and terrible puns.
ritCentral.exhibitors: James Schreppler, Neil Guertin, Sebastien DeCarbonnel, Eric Mitchell, Luke Frazer, Nicholas Boyle, Nick Taber, Andrew Litfin, James Hefner

ritCentral.name: Vis Viva Dance Company
ritCentral.description: Vis Viva Dance Company is a student run club inspired by our passion for dance and excitement to perform and share that passion with others! Our dances are student choreographed and feature all styles of dance and all levels of experience. We have worked hard this semester to create some amazing and creative performances to perform at Imagine RIT. Our dances will be a sneak-peek as to what our Showcase will be like on May 13!
ritCentral.exhibitors: Marcela Lopez, Taylor Agnello, Kaitlin Levine, Sarah Stanton, Madelyn Rominger, Amanda Bradley, Alexis Slentz, Hayley Killian, Carrie Ratkoski, Kristina Hinova, Claire Candelori, Lia Horyczun, Nicole Cavanaugh, Quinn Webb, Chelsea Mountain, Emilie Ravena, Kathleen Hagelberger, Rachael Thormann
